meanings.definition: A lively round dance resembling a polka, originating in Bohemia.
meanings.sent1: At the village fair, everyone joined in the schottische, twirling and laughing.
meanings.sent2: The band played a cheerful schottische, setting the perfect mood for the dance.
meanings.sent3: During the schottische, Tom accidentally spun the wrong way and bumped into the mayor.
meanings.sent4: The schottische of life keeps us moving in circles, sometimes faster, sometimes slower.
meanings.sent5: The colorful dresses and energetic steps made the schottische a memorable part of the celebration.

meanings.definition: A piece of music for this dance.
meanings.sent1: The lively schottische filled the room, making everyone tap their feet.
meanings.sent2: The musicians practiced the schottische, ensuring they played in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent3: The schottische melody was so catchy that it stayed in Mary's head all day.
meanings.sent4: The schottische music flowed through the air, lifting everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The joyful notes of the schottische echoed through the town square, inviting people to dance.

meanings.definition: A type of fabric with a twill weave.
meanings.sent1: The tailor used schottische fabric to create a durable jacket for the winter.
meanings.sent2: The elegant gown was made from a luxurious schottische material.
meanings.sent3: When Sarah accidentally spilled juice on her schottische skirt, it was easy to clean.
meanings.sent4: The schottische weave of the fabric gave it a unique texture and appearance.
meanings.sent5: The rich colors of the schottische fabric made the curtains stand out in the room.
